intro: Justicia heterocarpa subsp. vallicola, commonly known as the mountain justicia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has opposite, ovate leaves and produces cylindrical flower clusters. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in tropical regions.
